title: DNS & Website Access Issues
description: Fix 'This site can't be reached', DNS_PROBE_FINISHED, and server IP errors.

steps.title: Check with another Browser
steps.instruction: Try opening the site in Edge or Firefox. If it works there, the issue is your Chrome cache, not the network.

steps.title: Change DNS to Google
steps.instruction: Network Settings → IPv4 Properties → Use following DNS: 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4. This bypasses slow/broken ISP DNS servers.

steps.title: Reset TCP/IP Stack
steps.instruction: CMD as Admin → 'netsh int ip reset'. This resets your computer's internal map of how it talks to the internet.

steps.title: Check Hosts File
steps.instruction: Navigate to 'C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc'. Open 'hosts' with Notepad. Ensure there are no entries blocking your work websites.

steps.title: Disable IPv6
steps.instruction: Network Adapter Properties → Uncheck 'Internet Protocol Version 6 (TCP/IPv6)'. Some older routers struggle with IPv6 assignments.
